page.title: 13Royal Coat of Arms
page.content: The year 1985 has seen the completion of the restoration of the Royal Arms, which are situated in the church os St. John the Baptist. This restoration was begun with a visit by a conservationist, Miss Anna Hulbert, in January 1983. She said that, although in poor condition, these RoyalArms were among the most interesting she had ever seen. They are painted on boarding on the East wall of the nave high above the chancel arch, and measure about 2.25 metres high amd 6 metres wide. The arms depicted are those used by the four Stuart Kings and Queen Anne until 1707. On the lion's side of the arms is the Rose of England and on the unicorns side, the Thistle of Scotland. In a different kind of paint is the date 1661. This may have been a repainting or an insertion.
